document_title: AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c have overlapping functions in pollen development and pollen tube growth
summary_full: This study investigates the roles of two Rab GTPase proteins, AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c, in Arabidopsis thaliana. While single mutants of these genes show no obvious defects, a double mutant (AtrabD2b/2c) exhibits shorter siliques, primarily due to defects in pollen development and pollen tube growth. The double mutant produces deformed pollen with swollen and branched pollen tube tips, and a significant portion of ovules remain unfertilized. Both AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c are highly expressed in pollen and localize to Golgi bodies, suggesting a partially redundant role in vesicle trafficking essential for pollen tube elongation. The findings indicate that these two Rab proteins are crucial for male gametophyte development and function, with their roles not being fully compensated by other AtRabD family members.
key_findings: AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c single mutants have no observable morphological defects.
AtrabD2b/2c double mutants exhibit shorter siliques due to defects in pollen development and fertilization.
AtrabD2b/2c mutants produce deformed pollen with swollen and branched pollen tube tips.
AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c are highly expressed in pollen and localize to Golgi bodies.
These two Rab proteins have partially redundant functions in pollen tube growth that are not compensated by other AtRabD family members.
future_research_fields: Elucidating the precise molecular mechanisms underlying the pollen phenotype in AtrabD2b/2c double mutants.
Investigating the specific vesicle trafficking pathways regulated by AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c in pollen tubes.
Exploring the potential compensatory roles of other Rab GTPases in vegetative tissues.
Further characterization of the interaction between AtRabD2b/2c and SNARE proteins in pollen development.
related_papers: Pinheiro H, Samalova M, Geldner N, Chory J, Martinez A, Moore I. Genetic evidence that the higher plant Rab-D1 and Rab-D2 GTPases exhibit distinct but overlapping interactions in the early secretory pathway. J Cell Sci. 2009;122(Pt 20):3749-3758.

Cheung AY, Chen CY, Glaven RH, de Graaf BH, Vidali L, Hepler PK, Wu HM. Rab2 GTPase regulates vesicle trafficking between the endoplasmic reticulum and the Golgi bodies and is important to pollen tube growth. Plant Cell. 2002;14(4):945-962.

de Graaf BH, Cheung AY, Andreyeva T, Levasseur K, Kieliszewski M, Wu HM. Rab11 GTPase-regulated membrane trafficking is crucial for tip-focused pollen tube growth in tobacco. Plant Cell. 2005;17(9):2564-2579.
conclusions: AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c are Golgi-resident proteins with partially redundant functions in vesicle trafficking that are essential for normal pollen development and pollen tube growth. Their overlapping roles are critical for male gametophyte function, and these functions are not fully compensated by other members of the AtRabD family.
impact_statement: This study reveals the crucial, partially redundant roles of AtRabD2b and AtRabD2c in plant reproduction, specifically in pollen development and pollen tube growth, highlighting their importance in vesicle trafficking for tip growth.
